task_summary: Place the held milk_box gently onto the table surface and release, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator appears over a cluttered tabletop with several small bottles/cans and a central translucent cup. The instruction is to place down a milk_box that is presumed to already be in the gripper. The robot should position above the table, descend until surface contact, open the gripper to release the box, and then back off safely. Movements should avoid nearby objects and keep approach vertical to minimize collisions.
preconditions: tabletop is clear enough at target spot
perception provides a safe placing area
stepwise_plan: Move above target placing area on table
Lower slowly until gentle contact with surface
Retreat vertically to a safe height
success_criteria: milk_box rests stably on the table
failure_and_recovery: If contact not detected within expected depth, slightly reposition and retry lowering
If object sticks after opening, perform a small vertical jiggle and re-open
If area obstructed, select nearby clear spot and repeat
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the milk_box is released on the table and the arm is in a safe retreat pose.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear descent toward the table indicating impending contact phase.
frame_3.predicts_next: Anticipates surface contact followed by release action.

node_specs.description: Checks that the gripper currently holds the milk_box before attempting placement.
Move to a pose above the intended table placing spot with 10 cm clearance.
Descend slowly up to 8 cm until contact is detected at low force threshold.
Open the gripper to release the milk_box on the surface.
Retreat vertically by 10 cm to clear the placed object safely.

failure_modes: Object not in gripper at start
Surface contact not detected due to sensor noise
recovery_strategy: Abort and request pick if object not held
Slightly reposition laterally then repeat lowering
Perform small up-down motion and reopen
Shift place location slightly and retry
assumptions: Frames suggest approach and release over center table; exact 'milk_box' appearance is ambiguous, possibly not clearly visible, so object identity is assumed to be the one already held in gripper.
Placing location corresponds to central open table area seen across frames.
